he arrived, the "Quartet" that ran the Conservative show in opposition was David Cameron , George Osborne , Hilton and Andy Coulson ." Andy Coulson 's resignation: David Cameron and a question of judgment- Telegraph Blogs Ben Brogan: Presentationally, this looks terrible. Mr David Cameron is open to the charge that his judgment was faulty when he appointed Mr Andy Coulson . His line that his adviser paid his dues by resigning once, that he should not have to resign twice for the same mistake looks foolhardy. It is also bad news for George Osborne , who liked to take the credit for talent spotting Mr Andy Coulson and securing his appointment.
